info.name: ModWorkshop API Documentation
info.description: The ModWorkshop API is available for everyone to use. Do note that by using the API you must follow the following guidelines: 1. Do not spam the API. 2. Do not replicate the site or remove the need to visit the site to download mods. Exceptions: You are allowed to implement updates, you are allowed to make a mod downloadable to ease the process of joining a game with mods (Example: downloading maps). Integration to the site itself is fine too (We'll add ways to download mods directly to mod managers soon). 3. Respect user's privacy and do not store their information without their consent. At the moment, the API only supports GET requests. More support will come in the future, but will require the use of API keys.

item.name: Games
item.description: API routes for interacting with game sections.

request.description: It's like /mods but returns the game too. It's used to avoid 2 requests in the game section so it's faster.
Returns the user as they are supposed to be when inside of a game. Handles roles and colors.
Returns game data for a user. Currently used for roles.
Returns basic game data like announcements. For moderators, it returns report and waiting mods count.
Returns images of the mod
Upload a new image to the mod\
Returns data about a single image

request.description: Returns many mods, has a few options for searching the right mods
Creates a new mod
Returns a single mod

Deletes a mod and all of its contents.
Creates a transfer request, only once a user accepts can the mod be fully transfered.
Accepts incoming member request and make it active or delete it if rejected.
Add someone to be a mod member, it sends them a notification so they can accept the request

Registers a view for a mod, doesn't let you 'view' it twice
